pages.text: The basic filters. They come in three sizes: Small (9 slots), Medium (18 slots), and Big (27 slots). Right-click a filter item to open it and drag items or fluids into the slots.$(br2)Each filter can be set to $(l)whitelist$() (only allow these) or $(l)blacklist$() (block these). Works for both items and fluids.

pages.title: On Export vs Import
pages.text: Filters work on both sides of a transfer.$(br2)$(l)On an export channel:$() The filter controls what gets pulled out. Only items matching the filter will leave the source container.$(br2)$(l)On an import channel:$() The filter controls what gets accepted in. The destination will only take items that pass its filter.$(br2)Both filters are checked during a transfer. An item has to pass the export filter AND the import filter to move.

pages.title: Copying Filters
pages.text: You can copy and clear filter data with crafting.$(br)$(li)Copy: put exactly one configured filter plus one or more blank filters of the same item. Output gives that config on all outputs.$(li)Clear: put one configured filter by itself. Output is one blank filter.$(br2)If you mix filter types, use more than one configured filter, or use only blank filters, the recipe will not work.
